programme.title: Golf Academy
programme.desc: Professional golfers give advice on how to improve your game across all aspects, from the tee to the green. Here, English star Matthew Fitzpatrick offers some of his top tips.

programme.title: Golf Academy
programme.desc: Professional golfers give advice on how to improve your game across all aspects, from the tee to the green. Here, Swedish Major winner Pernilla Lindberg offers her top tips.

programme.title: Playing Lessons: Patty Tavatanakit
programme.desc: Former and current pros take viewers behind the ropes on the course, discussing such things as shot setup, club selection, and strategy. Here, Patty Tavatanakit leads the lesson.

programme.title: Playing Lessons: Kamaiu Johnson
programme.desc: With multiple wins on the APGA Tour, Kamaiu Johnson joins Bones on the course to share his tips and strategies for optimum success.

programme.title: Nick Dougherty's Tee Time Tips
programme.desc: Hear from former professional Nick Dougherty as he shares his Tee Time Tips to help you improve your game out on the golf course.

programme.title: U.S. Women's Open 2023
programme.desc: The fourth and final round of the 78th US Women's Open gets underway at Pebble Beach Golf Links in California. There were a record 2,107 entries into this year's tournament. (09.07)

programme.title: U.S Women's Open 2024 Highlights
programme.desc: Action from day four of the 79th US Women's Open in Pennsylvania. 2022 winner Minjee Lee held a share of the lead at five-under going into the final round after a strong third day. (02.06)

programme.title: Live U.S Women's Open Round 2
programme.desc: Day two of the 2025 US Women's Open, the second women's Major of the 2025 season. Japan's Yuka Saso reigns as champion.

programme.title: Connors v Borg 1976
programme.desc: Home favourite Jimmy Connors fought the number two seed Bjorn Borg in the finale to the men's singles at the 1976 US Open. Borg dispatched champion Manuel Orantes en route to the final.

programme.title: ATP Final: Doha
programme.desc: In Doha, Great Britain's Jack Draper - entering his fifth ATP final - comes up against fifth seed and 2020 tournament champion Andrey Rublev in the final of the 2025 Qatar Open. (22.02)

programme.title: WTA Final: Doha
programme.desc: Jelena Ostapenko's near seven-year wait to vie for a WTA 1000 title ends in Doha, as the former Grand Slam champion faces 23-year-old American Amanda Anisimova in an unseeded final. (15.02)

programme.title: WTA Final: Auckland
programme.desc: At the ASB Classic in Auckland, Naomi Osaka competes in her first final since 2022 as the former world number one faces number five seed Clara Tauson for this WTA 250 title. (05.01)

programme.title: ATP Final: Auckland
programme.desc: Gael Monfils becomes the second-oldest player to reach an ATP Tour final since 1990, as the 38-year-old Frenchman meets Belgian qualifier Zizou Bergs in Auckland at the ASB Classic. (11.01)

programme.title: Serena v Hingis 1999
programme.desc: Twenty-two years before Emma Raducanu's triumph over Leylah Fernandez, Serena Williams and Martina Hingis locked horns in an all-teenage final at the 1999 US Open in the women's singles.

programme.title: ATP Final: Dubai
programme.desc: A men's singles champion is crowned in the final of the Dubai Duty Free Tennis Championships, an ATP Tour 500 event in the United Arab Emirates. (01.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Dubai
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned in Dubai. Russia's Mirra Andreeva - the youngest-ever WTA finalist - and Denmark's Clara Tauson face off for glory. (22.02)

programme.title: WTA All Access Magazine
programme.desc: Go behind the scenes with an all-access look at the stars of the WTA Tour as they compete at premier events throughout the season.

programme.desc: A review of the 2025 BNP Paribas Open, a WTA 1000 event held in Indian Wells in the United States.

programme.title: ATP Final: Montpellier
programme.desc: In his 17th career final and second of 2025, Felix Auger-Aliassime takes on American qualifier Aleksandar Kovacevic, who stunned top seed Andrey Rublev, for the Montpellier crown. (02.02)

programme.title: WTA Final: Singapore
programme.desc: At the Singapore Open, Elise Mertens competes in her second final of the season as the 29-year-old Belgian faces the United States' Ann Li, who seeks her second WTA singles title. (02.02)

programme.title: WTA Final: Linz
programme.desc: Dayana Yastremska ends a near three-year wait to compete for a WTA title, as the Ukrainian faces the number four seed Ekaterina Alexandrova in the Upper Austria Ladies Linz final. (02.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Dallas
programme.desc: Denis Shapovalov targets his biggest career title yet, as the 25-year-old Canadian competes in the final of the Dallas Open against Norway's world number five Casper Ruud. (09.02)

programme.title: McEnroe v Borg 1980
programme.desc: With the French Open and Wimbledon secured, Bjorn Borg met defending champion John McEnroe in the men's singles final at the 1980 US Open. Borg was bidding for his first US Open title.

programme.title: Venus v Davenport 2000
programme.desc: The 2000 US Open women's singles final saw an all-American affair, as Venus Williams, making her fourth appearance here, met the world number one, Lindsay Davenport.

programme.title: ATP Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper competes in his maiden ATP Masters 1000 final at Indian Wells as the top-10 bound Brit faces Holger Rune. Draper knocked out Carlos Alcaraz in the last four. (16.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Mirra Andreeva meets top seed Aryna Sabalenka in the Indian Wells final. Sabalenka avenged her Australian Open defeat to Keys in the semis, while Andreeva dethroned Swiatek. (16.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Transylvania
programme.desc: A third career singles title is the target for Anastasia Potapova, as the world number 32 takes on unseeded Italian Lucia Bronzetti in the final of the Transylvania Open in Cluj. (09.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Buenos Aires
programme.desc: Joao Fonseca's soaring career hits new heights, as the 18-year-old becomes the youngest ATP clay finalist since Carlos Alcaraz when he faces Francisco Cerundolo in Buenos Aires. (16.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Rotterdam
programme.desc: Carlos Alcaraz attempts to cap his debut at the ABN AMRO Open in Rotterdam with a 17th tour-level title, as the top seed squares off against world number six Alex de Minaur. (09.02)

programme.title: WTA Final: Abu Dhabi
programme.desc: 2021 Olympic gold medallist Belinda Bencic looks to capture her first title since returning from maternity leave, as the Swiss star faces Ashlyn Krueger in the Abu Dhabi final. (08.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Miami
programme.desc: Chasing a record seventh men's Miami crown, Novak Djokovic - now the oldest ATP Masters 1000 finalist - takes on Jakub Mensik, aiming to win his first tour-level trophy. (30.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Miami
programme.desc: In Miami, the women's final get underway as top seed Aryna Sabalenka meets with home favourite Jessica Pegula in a repeat of last year's US Open decider. (29.03)

programme.desc: After upsetting top seed Daniil Medvedev in the semi-finals, Hamad Medjedovic targets the Open 13 Provence title as the 21-year-old Serb meets reigning champion Ugo Humbert. (16.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Delray Beach
programme.desc: A first tour-level title is within reach for Alejandro Davidovich Fokina, as the Spaniard looks to overcome seventh seed Miomir Kecmanovic of Serbia in the Delray Beach Open final. (16.02)

programme.desc: In the final of the Rio Open, defending champion Sebastian Baez takes on Alexander Muller. The Frenchman enters his second ATP final of the year after victory in Hong Kong. (23.02)
